database

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • database.Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the database class. It is a sqlite database that connects to the file in the database folder called scddata.db. It contains many functions for getting the required data from the database to be put on screen. It also contains a function to update the database upon the user request.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Close down the databases
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • update

        public int update()
        Remember what stuff the user has in their collection Downloads the most recent sqlite db file from the online source Add the ihave and tag columns back to the db Load the stuff we saved earlier back into the db
        Returns:
        1 on success; 0 when no internet connection; -1 on error, -2 on fatal error (app needs to restart)

                        throws java.sql.SQLException

      • saveIHave

        public void saveIHave()
               throws java.sql.SQLException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Save the information for what the user has in their personal collection. Writes the type (table), the id, and the tag to a file. We will use this information when we update to preserve this information.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException

      • loadIHave

               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.sql.SQLException
        After updating the database, load the collection information back into the database
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.sql.SQLException
